com.ojcoleman.europa.core

Class Gene

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ojcoleman.europa.configurable.Observable
      • com.ojcoleman.europa.configurable.ConfigurableBase
        • com.ojcoleman.europa.configurable.PrototypeBase
          • com.ojcoleman.europa.core.Gene
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Stringable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    VectorGene

    public class Gene
extends PrototypeBase

    Base class for representations of genes within a Genotype. A Gene represents a structural part of the genotype. The set of Genes in a Genotype may be fixed when the initial population is created or they may be added or removed by a Mutator or Recombiner. Any values a Gene contains should not be mutable; they should be fixed when the Gene is created.

    Note that an Allele belongs to a specific Genotype, but may share the same Gene as Alleles in other Genotypes. Alleles and Genotypes directly reference one another, but a Gene is only referenced by Alleles. A given Gene should only be included once in a Genotype.

    • Field Detail

      • types

        public final java.util.Set<java.lang.Object> types
        The type(s) of the gene, if applicable to the evolutionary algorithm in use. Usually these are enum constants. May be empty. The set is immutable (actually an Collections.unmodifiableSet(Set), but this class will never modify the set).

    • Constructor Detail

      • Gene

        public Gene(Configuration config)
        PrototypeBase constructor. See PrototypeBase.PrototypeBase(Configuration).

      • Gene

        public Gene(Gene prototype,
    java.util.Set<java.lang.Object> types)
        Copy constructor. See PrototypeBase.PrototypeBase(PrototypeBase).
        Parameters:
        prototype - The (prototype) instance to copy.
        types - The type(s) of the gene. Usually these are enum constants. May be empty. The given Set is passed through Collections.unmodifiableSet(Set) and then assigned to the types field, for this reason it should generally not be modified after being passed to this constructor.
        See Also:
        typeSet(Object...)

      • Gene

        public Gene(Gene prototype)
        Copy constructor. See PrototypeBase.PrototypeBase(PrototypeBase). Creates a Gene with no types.
        Parameters:
        prototype - The (prototype) instance to copy.
